basics.name: Petar Prole
basics.label: Senior Software Engineer
summary: Senior Software Engineer with 10+ years of experience developing enterprise applications for major clients including Audi, BMW, Volkswagen, Unicredit, and Bosch. Specialized in technologies such as Java, Kotlin, Spring Boot, React and Angular with extensive experience in microservices architecture, legacy system modernization, and cloud platforms.

Led development teams across banking, automotive, and logistics sectors, including real-time auction platforms, EDI solutions, and IoT applications. Expertise in implementing hexagonal architecture, Domain-Driven Design, and managing complex system integrations while ensuring compliance and regulatory standards.

Proven ability to work directly with stakeholders, conduct Event Storming sessions, and translate business requirements into scalable technical solutions. Experience mentoring development teams, managing release cycles, and maintaining production systems with high availability requirements adhering to the highest security standards.

As the owner and main consultant of jimp doo I am providing enterprise software engineering services with focus on microservices architecture, cloud-native solutions, and system modernization for international clients.

work.summary: Founder and principal consultant of jimp doo, delivering full-stack software engineering services to enterprise clients. Specialize in designing cloud-native, event-driven, and resilient backend systems while supporting cross-functional teams through hands-on leadership and technical mentorship.
highlights: Founded a consultancy focused on scalable, domain-driven software architecture
Delivered cloud-native solutions using Java, Kotlin, Spring Boot, and React
Led architecture and implementation of secure, containerized microservices on AWS and OpenShift
Established robust CI/CD pipelines and DevOps workflows for clients
Facilitated event storming workshops and defined domain boundaries for new product initiatives
Mentored developers on clean architecture, test automation, and system design
Managed client relationships and project roadmaps end-to-end

work.summary: I worked on diverse projects across various industries, collaborating with stakeholders to gather requirements, refine them into actionable user stories, and implement features following industry best practices. My role emphasized maintaining system integrity, fostering knowledge exchange across teams, and breaking down complex topics through events like event storming. I contributed to multiple projects ranging from modernizing legacy systems for banks, creating state of the art logistic solutions for Automotive giants and working on realtime Car Auction platforms, to name a few. Leveraging technologies such as Kotlin, Spring Boot, and AWS, I ensured solutions were scalable, reliable, and adhered to clean code principles.
highlights: Supported backend development with a focus on networking and containerized environments
Focused on streamlining development and ensuring system stability
Addressed challenges in maintaining clean code, applying TDD, and ensuring seamless integration and delivery
Ensured scalability and maintainability while following best practices in feature implementation
Maintained architectural integrity and optimized service communication within Azure and AWS-hosted environments
Overcame legacy system constraints in Java-based applications hosted on IBM WebSphere
Addressed integration challenges in a structured monolith environment with external service communication
Solved complexities in a microservice architecture using standards for EDI communication
Tackled IoT-specific challenges, including device connectivity

work.summary: I contributed to the development and maintenance of financial and banking applications, focusing on SEPA compliance and transaction processing. My responsibilities included creating SQL procedures, developing front-end and back-end modules, implementing REST APIs, and ensuring data integrity through robust validation processes. I collaborated with senior developers to deliver new features and provided ongoing customer support to ensure seamless application functionality.
highlights: Developed and maintained modules for financial transaction processing, including REST APIs and front-end interfaces
Implemented SQL procedures, data migrations, and persistence jobs to comply with SEPA regulations
Addressed challenges in XML transaction packaging, input validation, and ensuring seamless user functionality in banking systems

projects.name: Car credit and loan platform
projects.description:
Developing multiple services related to car credits using microservice architecture with Java and Spring in the backend and React in the frontend. OpenShift is used to manage the workloads, whilst Jenkins is used as the pipeline for the services.

Key responsibilities included:
• enhance system security and scalability
• maintaining existing functionality, whilst trying to improve current codebase
• developing features for missing products
• ownership of tasks from development to production
projects.keywords: Java, Spring, Microservices, OpenShift, React, Jenkins

projects.name: Used Car Auction Platform
projects.description:
Developed a platform enabling Audi to auction used cars to dealers. The application follows a structured monolith setup with components written in Kotlin and Java, and integrates with two external services.

Key responsibilities included:
• encapsulate business logic within the domain of the application
• decouple application
• generify commonly repeated tasks
• work with the stakeholders to better define the scopes and the goal
• oversea a group of junior colleagues
• developing features for missing products
• release management
projects.keywords: Kotlin, Java, Monolith Architecture, AWS, Domain-Driven Design, React

projects.name: Electronic Data Interchange
projects.description:
Built and maintained a microservice-based EDI solution for logistics communication between VW, suppliers, and shippers. Each service adhered to hexagonal architecture and was implemented in Kotlin, hosted on AWS with logical account separation.

Key responsibilities included:
• Develop solutions for highly complex business cases
• Work across multiple teams to disperse knowledge
• Automate processes
• Hold presentations about decisions taken and lessons learned
• Work closely with stakeholders and other teams to create a Ubiquitous Language
• Partake in Event Stormings
projects.keywords: Kotlin, AWS, Hexagonal Architecture, ArchUnit, Microservices, React, Trunk based development, Pair programming
